channel.title: Privacy on Silence Speaks
channel.description: Recent content in Privacy on Silence Speaks

item.title: Whispers in the Wind
item.author: me@silentsilas.com (Silent Silas)
item.description: The information above is just a small snippet of your browser’s fingerprint. It’s the data that websites can collect about the device you’re using. (They’re also able to access your GPS if you’re silly enough to let them.) At first glance, the data looks pretty innocuous. Who cares if people know what browser you’re using, or what plugins you’ve installed? Is it the end of the world if they know that you’re a Mac user?
